snippet: LEAD: Having considered a child-care bill for the last 20 years without much progress, the Federal Government may not pass any of the 150 measures now before Congress anytime soon, especially in light of the budget deficit. But state initiatives t...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: Having considered a child-care bill for the last 20 years without much progress, the Federal Government may not pass any of the 150 measures now before Congress anytime soon, especially in light of the budget deficit. But state initiatives to bolster child care are on the rise, and in many cases, are partnerships with industry.

headline.main: Partnerships Weave Security Blankets for Working Parents

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: BANK OF AMERICA NATIONAL TRUST & SAVINGS ASSN

byline.original: By KIRSTEN O. LUNDBERG; Kirsten O. Lundberg is a Boston-based writer
